Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pandahat
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel in a fantastic location, easy to reach from the airport (CDG) the rossiybus drops you at La Opera then it's a short walk. The metro is on the corner less than a minute from the door. Eating out is very expensive in Paris but found a nice bakery on Rue De Castellane minutes away doing a light breakfast. The hotel staff are very helpful and luggage can be left after check out if you have a late flight and want to make most of your last few hours in Paris. The Louvre is 20 minutes easy stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: leanne_malcesine
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in an amazing xity. The location is excellent,jusr off the champes elyses and a metro station around the corner. tHe rooms are small but have everything you need for a lovely stay. The staff are very helpful and would recommend this hotel.to family and friends

Reviews.Title: “Great metro location, helpful staff, overall good stay!”
Reviews.Author: saz2010
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Paris, booked this hotel as seemed good value for money and reviews were all generally good! Hotel was really clean, room was a good size, I was surprised after all the reviews complaining on size! Location was great for metro and within walking distance for many attractions! Only downside was finding reasonable places to eat but walking around you do eventually find somewhere, cafe on the corner does a good breakfast! Overall was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nick M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights before Christmas. Warm welcome from staff. Quiet hotel. We had a fantastic view over the Place Madeline despite only paying for a basic room at £60.00. Room with real character with enormous bathroom and generous storage area for clothes and bags. Well designed so there is an inner room door which ensures no corridor noise and secondary glazing ensures a good night's sleep despite overlooking a noisy traffic clogged square. Easy walking distance to some fantastic shopping and sights. Next door to a metro station. Breakfast at 14 euros isn't cheap but much better value than any of the local cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Good deal.”
Reviews.Author: b0tticelli
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the third floor and a window balcony that overlooked the back of the Madeleine church. This location was super and close to all of the food emporia in the plaza such as Hediard, Fauchon, Maille, Laduree, amongst others. The central location is close to the Louvre and Rue de Rivoli. The room was a light blue toile and clean. It could use new carpet, but they delivered new mattresses while we were staying there. The breakfast was great and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old room, traditional and elegant”
Reviews.Author: msg82256
Reviews.Content: We had the corner room on the third floor, two floors above the ground level cafe with a view out over the Madeleine church (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%89glise_de_la_Madeleine). It was a beautiful little room with windows on two sides and a nicely furnished space. The bed was a bit lumpy, and probably in need of a new mattress. But overall it is a nice hotel with an attentive staff and a perfect location with great Paris landmarks and attractions in every direction, north, south, east and west. ps: a great value as well. Our cost was 10 to 15% below similar hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Madeleine Plaza - Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Summer D
Reviews.Content: We were there in Dec 2011. It was an excellent hotel; the Staff were friendly and speaks English which was very helpful because our French were basic. The hotel clean, comfortable and our room was a good size. It was located in a very busy junction and our room was on the 1st floor but we could hardly hear the traffic noise outside. The room and widow must be very well insulated. The location was also perfect with good metro links and within 20min walk to many high market shops (Dior, Chanel, Armani etc) and attractions such as Champs de Elysee, pl de la Concorde, Jardin de Tuleries, Angelina Café etc. Our tip to save some money is not to eat breakfast at the hotel. Find a local food store nearby and buy the necessary breakfast items like milk and brioche. You can put them in the fridge in the bedroom and eat whenever you like to.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: loves2laugh29
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was so friendly and helpful the entire trip. The room was very nice and good sized. We had french windows that opened which was very nice. The location is right on a main intersection and the daytime traffic can be noisy but it quieted down at night and was very peaceful. The location is the best. It is one block from the city center Place de la Concorde which is in-between the Louvre, Notre dame, and Arch de Triomphe. The opposite direction is the Opera district. All are with-in walking distance of the hotel. The Eiffel Tower would be the furthest thing to walk to, and at a slow pace it is an hour walk. However you can view the tower from the end of the block. It's especially nice to only walk one block at night to view the tower when it twinkles on the top of the hour. If you purchase a two day pass on one of the hop on hop off tour buses you can use this as your taxi to learn how to get around and transport you places. It was very helpful to me. I loved this location and will stay here again if I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Bright lights big city...”
Reviews.Author: mwsillitoe
Reviews.Content: Just spent a great weekend with the wife. The hotel was ideally located, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was spacious with great views from the window. All in all a really nice place to stay in close proximity to the Metro and all of the best attractions. Nice little restaurant next door for good service and decent food at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Rose”
Reviews.Author: j R
Reviews.Content: I just return from Paris. One of the staff was not kind to me. When I checked in, he didn't explain well and made a mistake.When I checked out, his phone call had all his concentration. he spoke with friend, I guess.He made a mistake about my fee and he didn't even speak to me. just gesture! All other staff were excellent. It was pity!

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and service!”
Reviews.Author: dainty-bb
Reviews.Content: We went to paris for our honeymoon, and our very first visit to the city of love. There was no problem checking in and out, room was promptly cleaned daily. All staffs speak English whch is a plus point to non-French speaking travellers. We asked alot of other request such as helping us to charge our iphone (coz we bought the wrong adapter) and the staff working at the point of time was willing to helpout. Apart from from all that, location was perfect, centralised and near metro station and also various tourist attractions' places. The hotel is located 10 minutes away from Gallery Laffeyette and Printemps which is a shopping haven for us. We will definitely go back to this hotel. Thumbs Up!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SGP_Kent
Reviews.Content: Last minute 3 day break so didn't have too much time to do my usual research but found this recommended and booked the last room with a day to spare. We weren't disappointed. Within 20 mins of arriving on Eurostar we were in our hotel room. 30 mins later the hotel staff had pointed us in the right direction and we were off on our tour of Paris. First day was all walking, circular route from the hotel taking in the Arch, Eiffel Tower, Notre Darne, Place de la Concorde, etc. Second day with legs tired from the previous day we took the metro from virtually right out the front door! Everyone of the staff was helpful and happy to converse in English recommending good places to eat off the main avenues. Plenty of shopping close by for those wishing to indulge. Rooms are typically French, smallish but very confortable and equiped. Modern wet room as a bathroom was a pleasant surprise. We will recommend to friend and stay there again when we next return.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality, it ticked all boxes for Paris”
Reviews.Author: picknchoose
Reviews.Content: Three nights here to see the new and re-hung galleries at the Musée d’Orsay, which was within easy walking distance, as with Grand Palais for the Stein exhibition. The hotel is also closely located near the Metro (as with most places in Paris) in case of rain. Another bonus is that it’s only a few doors away from Fauchon; a shop that will relieve you of your money like a casino but the expensive prizes are the luxury foods. The hotel is very friendly and the staff were extremely helpful to those making their first visit to the city. The standard tariff is quite expensive (€200 +) but I got a very good rate through the Eurostar website when I booked my rail tickets. The room was a comfortable enough size for Paris and it provides the facilities of a Three Star Plus. You can get breakfast anywhere locally but what the hotel provides was of good quality, convenient and with a very good choice. Paris has a huge range of Two Star hotels, most of them reasonable, but for a few pounds more this was clearly in another league and provided that I could get the rate (this was November) I’d happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, great value.”
Reviews.Author: DrewMiles
Reviews.Content: We certainly didn't expect such a nice room with a view of St Madeleine at the price we got. Location A1. Paris is a city best experienced on foot and we walked everywhere including the Louvre, Champs Elysese and Arc De Triumph. Good shopping also close by. Great size room and bathroom, nice decor and helpful staff. Free wifi also a great bonus. Metro and buses very close. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and so central”
Reviews.Author: snaphappy_11
Reviews.Content: On arriving we were greated by friendly staff, who spoke good English and immediately made us feel welcome. We had read reviews about how small the rooms are in Paris in general, but we didnt find this was the case as we had plenty of room to move around. Our on suite twin room no 108 came with a mini bar, a wardrobe with an optional safe (an extra 3 Euros per day) bedside tables, tv, kettle and came with air conditioning. The bathroom was spotless and had both shower and bath. This being our first visit to Paris we found it more spreed out than we thought it would be and walked for miles so were greatful the hotel was central and the beds where comfy. The cafe next door downstairs offers main meals at about 15 to 20 Euros each and is great for people watching, we sat near Gyles Brandreth one night. If you go just off the square turn left at Laduree and down 400 Rue Saint-Honore there is a beautiful cake shop. Also in the Montmartre area there is Paris oldest chocolate shop A Le Mere De Famille 35 Rue Du Faubourg is certainly worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view and comfy room”
Reviews.Author: Cartney
Reviews.Content: Hotel was really nice - hotel staff were really helpful and spoke english :) Room was relatively small (not a lot of space for luggage) but not a bit problem. The bathroom layout was a bit weird (the toilet was in a seperate room just off the entrance and the bathroom with sink and shower/bath was off the bedroom), but it was really nice - I think they were refurbishing the bathrooms and ours had just been done. We were on the top floor and had an awesome view of the Madeline and the Eiffel tower. Location was very safe but it was a very expensive area - all of the designer stores so you are going to be paying around 5 euros for a coffee which was a bit too much for us.... Overall really nice but I would try and find a supermarket or something cheaper to try and bring down the dinner bills!!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: heat21a
Reviews.Content: Let me just say how fantastic a hotel this is. The staff is so nice and helpful, the rooms are nicely decorated, reasonably priced, and great location. I stayed here for business/work 2 times in May. The rooms are small but how much time are you really spending in the room? (Well I spent too much time in there working but that's a different story - the free wireless internet was great!) The location is very close to the Louvre and the subway is right out the door! When I needed a taxi the hotel staff was always happy to help. One note - if you need to pay the taxi by credit card, let them know before calling because not all taxis accept cc. Anytime I head to Paris I will definitely he staying here. There's also a great cafe just out the from door, which was very convenient. STAY HERE! I should mention that I am a VERY picky hotel person. I'm terrified that even in a Four Seasons people won't clean it. This hotel was clean and well kept so it's saying a lot! I should also mention again - free wireless internet and room noise. I know some other people said the traffic can make the room very loud but that wasn't the case. I had a room with 2 windows right on the plaza and it was totally fine, but what a view!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Can't wait to come back..”
Reviews.Author: SingoJnr
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after reading about it on tripadvisor. We knew the location as we had stayed nearby twice before, but this time was for a special occasion with my husband and my parents for mums 70th birthday. We paid for the superior rooms and I emailed ahead to request at least one room with a balcony for my mum and we were told that the balcony rooms were smoking rooms, but that they would do their best. On arrival at 12 noon, we were told that we had been upgraded to "deluxe" - one with balcony and one without. Our room without the balcony was on the 2nd floor (room 206) and was on the corner of the building so we had fantastic views from all around - the windows are floor to ceiling and you can open them right out and there is a guard rail halfway up outside, so it practically WAS a balcony!! The room was beautiful - all pale creams and pale blues and the bathroom was sparkling and, I think, brand new. (The bathroom also had one of these huge windows so everywhere was so light and bright.) The hairdryer was pretty powerful and their was a minibar in the room so you could buy your own wine and store it in there - nice and cold. Plenty of space for clothes in the room and the bed was really comfortable. Not a lot of noise from outside considering we were right opposite the Madeleine - just a fantastic view, even when lying in bed - perfect! My parents room with the balcony was on the 5th floor, again on the corner so with fantastic views all around, but this had a wraparound balcony - bit high for me but my dad loved it! The decor in this room was a bit dark for my taste, but aside from that it was exactly the same room as ours - same layout, bathroom and lovely huge windows. (I think the decor is dark as it was a smoking room, but it did not smell one bit of smoke - my parents arent smokers but would have put up with a bit of smokey aroma in exchange for a balcony but it was fine and fresh and clean.) As everyone has already said, fantastic location, close to everything, staff were lovely and very helpful and we were very sad to leave. I cant wait to go back. (By the way, we were in room 206 and my parents were in room 506 - with a balcony).

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pugdom
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just spent 6 nights at this hotel while visiting Paris. We selected it through Tripadvisor, and were so pleased to find it just as others had described. Our room had 2 twin beds which they told us meant there was a little extra space, no problem for us as we were out enjoying the far too much to be concerned over room size. Although it cost extra, we opted for the continental breakfast at the hotel in the interest of saving time. It wasn't anything elaborate, but was satisfactory. All the staff were wonderful! We never passed the desk without having a barage of questions, and everyone was extremely helpful. The location was better than I imagined, very central and near everything: Shopping, trains, museums, etc. We walked just about everywhere except for the day spent and Versailles, an easy train ride and education in the Paris subways. Rooms have "soundproof glass" windows which means most city noise is blocked, with the exception of police sirens.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decently priced, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: garygraphy
Reviews.Content: Great location, within striking distance of Madeleine metro and walking distance to Concorde with which both has most of the lines to bring you to the major places in Paris. Rooms and furnishings of decent quality. Don't expect large rooms as this is Paris! It's unfair to rate them poorly for small rooms. Free wifi with good connection speeds were welcome. We didn't bother with the hotel breakfast and just went downstairs to Fauchon for breakfast. Love being able to walk up to Opera within 5 mins and get quick access to main shopping boutiques along Rue Fabourg St Honore and to Lafayette/Printemps. Location is probably a bit thin on the value for money food and you probably have to travel out for that. Overall no complains and the stay was very pleasant. Staff was very friendly and helpful throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Good value right in front on the Madeleine Church”
Reviews.Author: BBreton
Reviews.Content: This 3* hotel is located right in front of the Madeleine Church. This means being well located but, somewhat on a busy street. The hotel is clean and the service excellent. The rooms are surprisingly large for Paris and for the price. Also, the bathrooms are very clear and nicely appointed. Finally, wireless internet is available in all rooms and for free. I certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: depexmode
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Madeleine Plaza is my favourite hotel in Paris: I slept there for the third time and, as usual, I was satisfied with service; the rooms are not too large (but in Paris it is the rule) but very clean; we had the room facing the secondary street as the ones facing place de la madeleine have a wonderful view but are a little bit noisy for me; wi-fi connection is on request and it works well; buffet breakfast is not cheap but it's worth; the staff is nice and helpful; I will come back to the Hotel Madeleine Plaza for sure in my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value- superb location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: vorgue3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on first trip to Paris- Oct. 29 thru Nov. 6. Superior room on the 6th floor with a balcony- perfection! Traveling with my 71 year old mother who had a health situation after the long trip over from the US and the hotel staff was immediately helpful and attentive. Throughout the remainder of our stay, they were caring and always making sure we were comfortable and all was well. The front desk personnel spoke excellent English and even endured my pitiful French! They were always willing to help us with directions, suggestions for restaurants nearby (of which there are many), Taxi and Metro assistance. The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms were beautifully updated, but be aware that the showers aren't like American showers- the "door" is only about 1/3 of the way down the tub, so you have to stand right under it with the nozzle pointing down or you'll spray water all over the bathroom! Only a minor inconvenience- and the only one that I encountered my entire stay. I would not hesitate to recommend this fine establishment to anyone planning a trip to Paris! Its in an outstanding location- within walking/strolling distance to many of the main attractions, and with easy access steps from the lobby door to Metro entrances and bus lines to easily get around this fantastic city. If you are planning a trip to Paris- you can't go wrong with the Hotel Madeleine Plaza!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a night in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AirAlf
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a night in September 2008 and loved the central location of it. Rooms were alright and the value for money was great. I would recommend this place if you look for something central and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: Moradilla1953
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Paris, among other European cities, to celebrate our 37th wedding anniversary. We were more than pleased with the Hotel Madeleine. We were given an upgraded room on a high floor with a loft and wrap-around balcony, with a view of the Eiffel Tower which, fortunately for us, offered a great light show the night we were there. We also had a direct view of La Madeleine church, located in the Madeleine Plaza, directly behind and within walking distance of the Place de La Concorde. The Metro, a taxi pickup location, and a "hop on and off" bus stop are all adjacent to the hotel, as is an indoor/outdoor cafe that has nothing to do with the hotel. Hotel offers continental breakfast, but we opted for the sidewalk cafe for the experience. Young man by the name of Youshao at front desk (who thankfully spoke English), and really, everyone we dealt with at the hotel including the manager were very friendly, patient, and accomodating (unfortunately, unlike some of the locals we encountered on the outside). Definite plus: it has an elevator and a/c in the rooms, and our room had a very comfortable king bed and nice roomy bathroom. Free internet in the lobby. Hotel very clean, and all this for an affordable price. We were very happy with our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rossetti21
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at this hotel and, from my experience there, I would have no hesitation in recommending it. On arrival I found the reception staff to be friendly, welcoming and efficient. The rooms are a little on the small side, but perfectly adequate. I heard nothing of the people in the next room or above so it was a peaceful stay. There is a little traffic noise but nothing untoward. I did not take breakfast here so cannot comment on that aspect (but think 14 euros per person is a little expensive). I used the cafe next to the hotel but there are plenty of others in the area. The hotel is within walking distance of many major attractions and the famous large department stores of Printemps and Lafayette. The Metro is only a few metres away and there are lots of restaurants in the vicinity. All in all, a very pleasant stay. I hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, but poor service”
Reviews.Author: valbert01
Reviews.Content: I stayed one week at this hotel for business. The room was quite small and noisy (they say the windows are noise-proof, but in fact you can still hear all the traffic from the room). My room was 603 and I definietly does not recommend it. However I have to ackowledge that location is excellent ! !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: LucyGus
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Madeleine has a wonderful location, right on Place de la Madeleine. It is walking distance to everything -- the Louvre, Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower, Place de la Concorde. Our room was not huge, but big enough -- spend the extra for a balcony. Don't buy the breakfast. It is overpriced and there are wonderful bakeries a couple of minutes away. Free internet! We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A small cozy hotel in the center with a beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: GoAdvisor
Reviews.Content: A small cozy hotel in the center with a beautiful view. Free wi-fi. Do not take breakfast in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bjegmand
Reviews.Content: The hotel is sure worth the 3 stars it has got. We stayed there 7 nights. The room was big enough for one week stay, the bathroom was good and clean and the view to the Madeleine church was good. Its possible to cover most of the central atractions by walking and there is a metrostation with 3 lines just behind the corner. The negative things to say is that you hear very easily what is happening at the room next to yours and you we got tobacco smoke in our room even though the whole floor was a non smoking area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: SAADE
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my wife and child of 4 years in November. We stayed for 12 days. the location is fantastic next to a rental car, metro station, near to many attractions, restaurants and supermarkets. The room had European standards (small), the breakfast was great and the staff extremely friendly and attentive as well as being fluent in several languages. There, free internet (wireless).It was our first trip to Paris, we love the city Thanks to the location of the hotel we saw all the places on foot, using the stroller, we walked from the Arch of triumph till the place des Vosges, sacre coeur till the Latin Quarter, everything. We will certainly return to the Madeleine Plaza Thanks to everyone, especially Stephanie from the front desk

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DIVNDOC
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Madeline, our honeymoon. It was perfect. Staff were always pleasant and helpful. Room was well cleaned daily. Typical and very good European continental breakfast. Quite satisfying. Location alows walking to almost anywhere in Paris central and you are right on the metro. And the view!! To lay in bed and be able to stare out at the Madeline with the lights on in it in the evening was wonderful. Can not imagine doing better for a small quaint hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, friendly staff, clean rooms and perfect hotel for our 7 night stay”
Reviews.Author: JLatzman
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Paris and first time staying at the Hotel Madeleine Plaza. The location is perfect -- near the Metro, cafes, great shopping, wonderful cafes/restaurants, the L'Olympia Theater and so much more. Our room was on the fifth floor and we had an amazing view of the Madeleine Plaza and the Eiffel Tower, with a balcony. Our room was very clean and for an European hotel, it was spacious (we had 4 suitcases, shopping bags and plenty of room to move about). The bathroom was spacious and cleaned every day with fresh towels. The staff was always smiling and gracious to help us with our questions, especially the night gentleman who always let us in well past midnight. Many thanks to Hotel Madeleine for making our visit such a great experience. When we return to Paris....we will return to Hotel Madeleine Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hewhew
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights in hotel madeleine plaza. Great location. Near shopping stores, restaurant, a coffee shop next door, and the madeleine church. Hotel room is quite small, but that's expected in Paris. AC was not as cool as other hotels. The male front desks were a lot nicer than the females, don't know why. Sami (front desk, night shift) was the best!!! He helped us book a day trip to the Versailles and did not mind working extra 1/2 hour to make sure we're confirmed. 4 thumbs up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: boston_britt
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and was very pleased with it in every way. I was travelling alone and found the area safe, even late at night. The location is terrific, I walked almost everywhere and only took the metro back from the Eiffel Tower and to/from the Gare du Nord. The room was a good size, clean and well-appointed, the bed was comfortable and bathrom was perfectly adequate. The only reason I gave the room 3 stars was that my room was on the first floor at the back of the hotel and hence was a little dark and had no view. However since I was only in my room to sleep I really wasn't too bothered. (In fact I suspect that I was given this room because I was travelling alone.) The staff was helpful and polite. The breakfast was a rip-off but that seems to be standard in Parisian hotels. Skip it and got to a cafe or grab a cappuccino and pain au chocolat at Fauchon across the plaza. Or even get some supplies at Monoprix around the corner and eat in your room. All in all this hotel would be top of my list when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Greatest Value”
Reviews.Author: Bifford
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel due to a colleague who I was travelling with. I will agree with most that the location of the hotel is ideal; however, I'm sure there are better hotels within this price range only a few blocks away. On my next trip, however, I will return to the south west side of the 17th arrondissement (where I stayed on a previous trip). I give an overall rating of three; however, if I was not able to change my room half-way through my trip, I would have given this hotel an overall rating of two. The first room I had was terrible – it was musty. You could smell the mildew as soon as you opened the door and the air conditioning did not work in this particular room (506). After suffering from severe allergies, I asked to be moved to a "newer" room that did not have mildew and a musty smell. The front desk seemed to be aware of the issue and was able to move me to a different room (206); unfortunately, this was only for my last night. There are safes in the rooms; however, you need to rent them! The breakfast is terrible for the price of 14 Euros! All that is offered are boiled eggs, croissants, bread, yogurt, juice, coffee and cheese (in plastic wrap – the kind you get on planes!). The dining area felt more like a pub. Other hotels in the area offer breakfast for 20 Euros… not only does this include white linens, but also coffees (Americano, espresso, cappuccino, etc.), juice, eggs (scramble, boiled), variety of chesses (not in plastic packaging), variety of sliced meats, bacon, sausage, yogurt, fresh fruit (strawberries, mango, pineapple, etc), croissants, breads, a variety jellies and jams, etc. If you are to stay here: (1) Request a room on floors 2-4 (2) Have breakfast elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Stay away! there are much nicer hotels in this fantastic area”
Reviews.Author: ChristieandTravel
Reviews.Content: Back in 2008 we stayed at the hotel Opal, rue Tronchet, located not very far away from the hotel Madeleine Plaza but I wished we had stayed there back again because our experience in this Plaza hotel was terrible. We could only check-in late in the afternoon while reception desk told us it would be cleaned and available earlier, as a result we've lost time waiting the first day. Second problem was the room itself that I would not consider as 'cleaned' as it should have been. Above all, the arrogance and very unpleasant staff at the reception desk is the reason why we felt we had to submit this review to warn futur visitors. Stay away also form their airport shuttle offer, very expensive and we almost missed our flight! Next time, no doubt, we'll be happy to return to Hotel Opal because we love this area close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location, Great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ThatLittletravelbug
Reviews.Content: We had a queen suite with a bathroom off the bedroom. The room was nice and very roomy for Paris standards. Great views over Place de La Madeleine. Breakfast in the hotel is simple and a little expensive at 14 Euro, although it is buffet. Hotel staff speak English very well. The service was adequate although do not expect 5 star service. The real plus for this hotel is the location. Within walking distance all the Paris attractions, shopping, cafes etc. We would stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: kurlz511
Reviews.Content: I just returned and couldn't wait to submit this review. I absolutely enjoyed my week long business trip at this hotel. Transportation- from CDG airport the easiest and cheapest method is the Roissy bus to the Opera. In terminal 2a the bus is outside door 9 and is clearly marked. Cost is about 9 Euro, (you can get a ticket from the driver). From the Opera it's only a five minute walk to the hotel. Just map it before you leave so you know the streets to take to the hotel (there are only two, very simple). Since it was raining I took a cab from the bus. What a waste. The ride cost only 4.20 Euro but there is a minimum rate of 5.80 so I should have just walked. Check In - I arrived Sunday morning around 11am and was told that I couldn't check in until 2pm. Unfortunately it was raining and to my surprise just about every store in that part of town is closed on Sundays! So I had lunch at the cafe next door and then waited in the hotel lobby until the front desk let me check in around 2:30. I was so exhausted from my overnight flight from NY that I basically went to sleep when I got to my room and woke up the next morning for work. Which was actually a good thing because it eliminated most of my jet-lag. Accommodations- Room was small (typical for Europe) but fine for one and probably acceptable for two if you don't have a lot of luggage. It had two twin beds which were connected. Not the most comfortable beds but I had no problem sleeping. The bathroom had a shower/tub combo. I'm 5'6" and had no problem with the shower height or stream power (although it could have been stronger). Closet was very small (it had a safe which you can rent the lock for 3Euros a night at the front desk) and there was a two drawer tiny dresser designed to put your suitcase on the top. TV had two English language channels, CNN World and BBC News. There was a mini-bar and a desk too. I did not pay for the hotel internet service and instead connected to an unsecure wireless network that my computer picked up. Best part of the room was the window. It was HUGE, with a little iron trellis across it when you opened both sides. Breakfast - The hotel buffet was convenient. Nothing terribly special, but it was fresh. Easier to eat there than trying to find restaurants open early in the morning (many restaurants are not open before 8am). The buffet had breads, croissants, butter, jam, cream cheese, poached eggs, ham (deli-style), cheddar cheese, four cereals (corn flakes, museli, chocolate crisps and I think the last was Special K), dates/raisins, juices, yogurts and coffee/tea. It cost 12 Euros a day. A little costly for what you get but it would be hard to find the same for less in that area. Commuting - I took the Metro to my office throughout the week. Very easy to use the Metro to get around the city. The entrance to the Madeleine stop is on the side of the hotel. Get a pass if you're going to use it for more than a few days. Shopping - GREAT AREA for high end shops. Rue du Faubourg Saint-Honoré is an amazing street for fashion just a few blocks away. In the other direction are some huge department stores. Just remember that most shops don't open until mid-day and close by 7 or 8pm. And as I mentioned before most are not open on Sundays. Frankly I'm shocked by the limited hours. It was hard to fit in much shopping after working all day. But since this was a business trip and not a 'vacation' I really can't complain. If you have all day to wander around though you'll be fine. Overall the hotel was more than sufficient, centrally located, comfortable, clean and the staff was very nice. The front desk staff spoke English and were more than willing to help with anything you needed. I would absolutely return again. One note: don't book on their website, either call or use a travel agent. They overbooked someone the first night and told him it was because the internet booking gets lowest priority. They had to put him at another hotel for the first night and he was NOT happy.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Madeleine”
Reviews.Author: Boogie77
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel and stepped into the lobby, I had a feeling that this hotel was going to be above average, especially for the price. When I entered my sun drenched room, I dropped my pullman, ran to the balcony and did a "Sex and the City" dance a la Carrie. The room was perfect. It was large though it did have a single bed and had a huge balcony with views of the Madeleine Church, the Eiffel Tower, the Obelisk and more. It was heavenly. The balcony stretched to the pristine bathroom where there was another entrance to the balcony. The toilet was in a separate room cose to the entrance and it was also in immaculate condition. The hotel staff was kind and courteous. The continental breakfast was lackluster.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about some of the staff!”
Reviews.Author: BarryBethal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and nicely furnished, it's just a shame about two or three of the staff. Firstly we received what you could hardly call a warm welcome and then we also had a bad experience . . . On buying an hour internet pass we logged on had a quick google then logged off using the necessary windows on screen. We went on later and the message said the time had expired. I went down to speak to the lady on reception only to be told you have to use it in one go, which it does not say anywhere as far as I could see. Fair enough and we weren't told this when we bought it. She promptly apologised and said we should have been told this and it was their fault . . . I had to ask for another pass and she tried to charge us another 9EUR. On asking whether we got this for free, she said no sorry we would have to pay, reminding her she'd just admitted it was the hotel's fault she said sorry but there wasn't a lot she could do and the general message was "tough luck". However, she did say she would speak to the manager. On giving her my room number so she could call us we never received a phone call. On paying the hotel bill when leaving I'd decided not to bring up the internet situation when paying as I couldn't really be bothered with an argument over 9EUR which I sense we'd have gotten into and bearing in mind we wanted to leave our bags there it was probably better not to go there! On settling the bill we were dealt with by a member of staff who generally strutted around in a manner that suggested she thought she was better than everyone else and looked to have a poor attitude which was proved right when the only things we were asked were "room?", "anything from the mini bar?", "389 euros". No please, no thank you, no how was your stay, nothing curtious at all! When collecting our bags I did say something to a young guy behind the desk regarding who to write to regarding a complaint. He was very polite and we discussed it as he asked what the problem was and he understand my point of view and was generally a really nice guy, I was tempted to also mention the attitude of the staff member who checked us out too but she was over like I shot for a good ear wigging so couldn't really say anything! Besides this, room wise we went for a superior. It was a decent size, very Parisian and overlooked the Madeleine Church. We never bothered with breakfast as we just had a crossiant in the local cafes. We paid 190EUR a night which was reasonable considering the location, room size and view but to be honest, as stated, the general attitude of two or three members of staff soured our stay really. Having read some of the other reviews, I'd be curious to know what shifts these friendly and helpful staff worked!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Madeleine Plaza”
Reviews.Author: michaelchoy
Reviews.Content: excellent location with easy access to the main tourist attrations : the Arc of trumph, the opera, the famous department stores .Nice and friendly staff.Breakfast is simple.Close to famous food shop . Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice!!”
Reviews.Author: LVEH
Reviews.Content: PROS: - Very Parisian Room; - Amazing view from Madeleine; - Great location (plus: in front of Fauchon); - Very helpfull staff but sometimes not so effective(see below); CONS: - DO NOT BOOK THEIR TRANSFER !!!!! The price was good, the hotel staff was very helpfull BUT THE TRANSFER IS REALLY BAD!!! We booked for 7:00(morning) and advise that we had 4 huge luggages. THey said he would come 6:45. Ok!! He came 6:30!!!!! WE RUSH, WE WERE OBVIOUS NERVOUS(we also had a 12hs flight), and when we were at the lobby: I has a EXTREMALLY BAD ATTITUDE and sayd he could not wait and would pick us up later!! LATER!?!?!??! I didn´t speak English, We were VERY,VERY nervous!!!!!!! The hotel employee didn´t know what to do, he was justifying the driver attitude. THEM, I decided to cancel and call a cab! The taxi driver was VERY POLITED AND HELPFULL!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jemimagold
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 2 nights (Feb. 29 - Mar. 2) and had a nice stay. It was not the best 3-star hotel I have ever stayed at in Paris but given the location and what I wanted to do in Paris for these 2 days (shop in this area of town!), I was happy with my choice. Here are the pros and cons of the Hotel Madeleine Plaza: PROS: 1. Great location - directly on the Pl. de la Madeleine and in the heart of an extensive shopping area. Metro stop is across the "Place de la Madeleine", only about 100 meters away. 2. Amazing views from our room. We booked their cheapest room (170 euros/nt.) and were given a room on the 5th floor which had a balcony and a view of the Eiffel Tower, as well as directly faced the Madeleine Church. 3. Hotel seemed well cared for and looked stylish. There were nice French prints on the walls, heavy toile de jouy curtains, refrigerator in room, coffee maker (instant) in room, nice small marble bathroom. The bar was cozy and had exposed brick walls for ambience. 4. Well priced for this location and quality of hotel.(170 euros/nt.) 5. Next door to Hediard (large gourmet food store) and Fauchon is about 100 meters away - similar gourmet food store. Fauchon is very good for the traveler as it has take away meals, breads and coffee but note that it is closed on Sunday. CONS: 1. Despite requesting a non-smoking room, we were given a room that clearly smelled of smoke. 2. Rude staff that told us that "it was not permitted to have coffee sent up to the room. Only a full breakfast (12 euros pp) can be sent to the room." Now, if they can bring up a tray with a full breakfast, what is so hard about bringing up a pot of coffee and 2 cups??? I guess they wanted to force us into to their expensive breakfast deal. 3. This area of town is completely dead after 7 pm so if you are looking for cafe lilfe/nightlife, you would be better off staying in the St. Germain area. (Personally, I thought the peace and quiet was nice). The large cafe next door closes at 8 pm or so. We wanted to have a drink after dinner and there was absolutely nowhere to go except the hotel bar (v. mediocre wine served in brandy snifters. Not worth the 5 euros per glass.). 4. Room was stuffy. Could not get the heat off in our room, despite turning the knob to "off" and the control down to 10 degrees. Slept with the window open to try and get fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel1010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Madeleine Plaza in February 2008 and found the hotel to be in the perfect location. The room was small but excellent for our needs. Would have preferred a room on a higher floor so if you get the chance to request a room, ask for a higher floor as views were limited on the 1st Floor. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone that wishes to stay in Paris. Daniel Melbourne, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Plaza”
Reviews.Author: stringman25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Madeleine Plaza for four nights in August 2005. I booked it through expedia after extensive research and was not dissapointed at all. The hotel is located about 20 steps from a Metro stop. It couldn't be more convenient. There was shopping close and several restaurants one of which was right next door, very convenient for breakfast. If you wanted to explore from the hotel without getting on the Metro the Louvre was only a 5-10 minute walk away. Good shopping was located about 5 minutes away. The Champs Elysse was only a 5-10 minute walk as well. The rooms were small but this is Paris...get used to it. They were very clean and some had a view of the city. The staff was very friendly and spoke many languages. Breakfast buffet was offered for quite a high price so I didn't try it. After staying at several hotels in Paris and seeing others, I will only stay here when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, beautiful corner room”
Reviews.Author: msg82256
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights here in September. We had a lovely corner room on the third floor looking out over the Madeleine Plaza and the popular little cafe just below the hotel. Room was small, but with plenty of windows, and a comfortable bed. The location was great, close to the Tuilerie Gardens and some of the nicer shopping areas of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Korey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights at this hotel, and overall we were pleased with the experience and certainly felt that it was a great value for the price we paid. Our main goals for a hotel were cleanliness, good location, good shower, and having a room which allowed for a good night's sleep. The hotel definitely delivered on all those counts. The only negative was the size of the room - even smaller than we imagined, and barely enough space to walk around after putting down our bags. However, since we were only in the room to sleep, it wasn't a huge problem. Overall, the deck staff was friendly and helpful, except for one woman who seemed to be annoyed in general at doing her job (unfortunately, she was the one working when we checked in!). However, we would recommend this hotel for anyone with the same goals as us. We wouldn't gush about it like in some other reviews, but it was certainly pleasant.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Madeleine Plaza
HotelInfo.Address: 33 Place De La Madeleine | 08 Arr., 75008 Paris, France
